transcripts.text: Yes — happy to continue. I’ll keep things high-level and avoid any confidential details.

Hi — I’m Luné, an AI interviewer. This will be a conversation about how you’re using ChatGPT Enterprise in your day-to-day work — what you use it for, what’s working well, what’s challenging, and what impact you’ve seen. Please keep examples high-level and avoid any confidential details. Take your time — pauses are fine. If you’re thinking, you can say ‘give me a second’ and I’ll wait. Are you happy to continue?
Yes, that’s fine.
Thanks — for these 1–5 questions, 1 is the lowest end and 5 is the highest end (the most positive). To start, at a high level, what’s your role and what kind of work fills most of your week?
I’m a Customer Success Manager. Most of my week is customer calls, adoption planning, QBR prep, stakeholder follow-ups, and coordinating internally on escalations and renewals.
What are you most on the hook for — the things that really matter if they don’t get done?
Keeping accounts healthy: driving product adoption, making sure stakeholders see value, preventing churn risks from becoming surprises, and keeping execution tight on success plans.
What kinds of tasks do you use ChatGPT Enterprise for in a typical week?

Drafting customer-facing emails, summarizing meeting notes into action items, turning a messy set of notes into a clean success plan, brainstorming agendas for QBRs, and rewriting internal updates to be clearer.
And using that same 1–5 scale—how often do you use ChatGPT Enterprise in a typical work week?
4 out of 5 — I use it most days, usually in short bursts.
Just to confirm — is that a 4 out of 5?
Yesterday after a customer check-in, I needed to turn the discussion into a crisp follow-up: recap, decisions, risks, and next steps, plus a draft 30‑day adoption plan we could align on.
Tell me about the last time you used ChatGPT Enterprise for a real work task—ideally something you had to think through.
Create a follow-up that the customer could act on: clear priorities, owners, timeline, and a simple plan that matched what they said they cared about.
How did you use what ChatGPT Enterprise gave you—what did it change about your next step?
I pasted in my high-level notes (sanitized), asked for a structured recap + action plan, then used the draft to build the actual email and a short internal summary for my team.
Before you used or shared it, did you do any quick check or tweak?
Yes — I sanity-checked tone and accuracy against my notes, rewrote a couple of lines to match the customer’s language, and removed anything too specific before sending.
In that workflow, did you use any specific features in ChatGPT Enterprise—for example Canvas, Deep Research, Codex, or a custom GPT—or was it mainly standard chat?
Mainly standard chat, but I did use Canvas to polish the email and the action-plan formatting.
Got it — switching gears slightly. How did you do that workflow before ChatGPT Enterprise, and how do you do it now?

Before, I’d manually rewrite my notes and it took longer to get it crisp. Now I start from a structured draft, then I edit for correctness and stakeholder tone. The final version is still mine, just faster to produce.
Thanks — thinking about that workflow, on a 1–5, how well did ChatGPT Enterprise fit into it?
4 out of 5 — it fits well, especially for structure and wording.
Was that fit pretty typical for you, or was this an unusual case?
Pretty typical. Any time it’s notes → summary → plan, it’s a good fit.
That’s helpful—stepping back for a moment. When we discussed that workflow, you mentioned using Canvas. More generally, do you use Canvas often in your work, or was it more of a one-off?
I use Canvas a couple times a week — mostly when I want a cleaner, more readable customer-ready draft.
Any other ChatGPT Enterprise features you use regularly?
Occasionally Deep Research for public context on an industry or competitor landscape, but most of my use is standard chat plus Canvas.
That’s helpful—stepping back for a moment. What changed for you as a result—time, quality, confidence, or something else?
Mostly time and clarity. I can send a higher-quality follow-up the same day instead of letting it slip, and the structure is consistently better.
Got it—thinking about your day-to-day work, on a 1–5, how much impact has ChatGPT Enterprise had for you?
4 out of 5 — it’s a meaningful lift for the parts of my job that are writing-heavy.
Roughly how much time does it save you in a typical week—would you say none, under 2 hours, 2 to 5, 5 to 10, or more?
Probably 2–5 hours a week, depending on how many customer follow-ups and QBRs I’m doing.
Got it—zooming out: when do you decide not to use ChatGPT Enterprise?
When I’m dealing with sensitive customer specifics, exact contract language, or anything where precision has to be perfect and I don’t want to risk leaking details into a prompt.
What makes that off-limits for you?
It’s usually confidentiality and the need for exactness — like legal wording, pricing, or very customer-specific implementation details.
What do you do instead in those situations?
I use internal templates, keep details in our systems, and write the sensitive parts manually. Sometimes I’ll ask ChatGPT Enterprise for a generic structure, but I don’t include specifics.
That’s helpful—stepping back for a moment. Do you or your colleagues ever share prompts, examples, or tips about ChatGPT Enterprise—or is it mostly self-taught?
Better safe ways to reference internal context without pasting details, plus clearer guidance on what’s okay to include and what isn’t.
What’s helped you most to use ChatGPT Enterprise well—any enablement, examples, or best-practice sharing?
Sorry, I misunderstood your previous question... when it comes to colleagues A bit of both. Some teams share examples in Slack, but a lot of it is still personal experimentation.
Got it—on a 1–5, how supported do you feel to use ChatGPT Enterprise well?
3 out of 5 — I can make it work, but more examples and guidance would help.
Got it— when you’re unsure, what do you usually do?
What do you mean?
I mean if you're not certain how to get the best results from ChatGPT Enterprise, do you ask colleagues, experiment on your own, or try something else?
Ask colleagues
What would help most—a few examples, short training, office hours, or clearer guidance?
Seeing a few strong example prompts for common CSM tasks (follow-ups, success plans, QBR structure) and learning a simple routine: ask for structure first, then tighten tone.
Thanks—if leadership could do one thing in the next month to make ChatGPT Enterprise more useful, what should it be?
Publish a short set of role-based templates and do a quick enablement push so people stop reinventing the wheel.
Is there anything important we didn’t cover?
Nope
Thanks—that’s really helpful. I appreciate your time.
